intro: Moltkia graminifolia, commonly known as the slender milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, growing in sandy or rocky soils. Moltkia graminifolia is a low-growing perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
